comments:
The tests on the 20030207 nigthly build contains the following error:

Could not connect to VM

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException[120]: java.net.BindException: Address
already in use
at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketBind(Native Method)
at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.bind(PlainSocketImpl.java:430)
at java.net.ServerSocket.<init>(ServerSocket.java:191)
at java.net.ServerSocket.<init>(ServerSocket.java:103)
at
org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketTransportImpl.listen(SocketTransportImpl.java:50)
at
org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketListeningConnectorImpl.startListening(SocketListeningConnectorImpl.java:97)
at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMDebugger.run(StandardVMDebugger.java:190)
at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.JavaLocalApplicationLaunchConfigurationDelegate.launch(JavaLocalApplicationLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:102)
at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:151)
at
org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests.AbstractDebugTest.launchAndWait(AbstractDebugTest.java:136)
at
org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests.AbstractDebugTest.launchAndTerminate(AbstractDebugTest.java:239)
at
org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests.AbstractDebugTest.launchAndTerminate(AbstractDebugTest.java:223)
at
org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests.core.ExceptionBreakpointTests.testDisabledUncaughtNPE(ExceptionBreakpointTests.java:93)
at org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests.AutomatedSuite$1.run(AutomatedSuite.java:146)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:512)


This problem can occurs if an other program (/plugin/code snippet) binds the
selected port between the time the port is selected (StandardVMDebugger, line
118), and the time it is binding by the connector (StandardVMDebugger, line 190).

In practice, this is very rare (in fact, this the first I have seen it). 
Deferred.
